intro: Rubus erectus, commonly known as the erect blackberry, is a shrub native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its thorny stems and clusters of white flowers. The plant produces small, dark purple to black berries that are edible and often used in jams and pies. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and have a serrated edge, while its roots are fibrous and can spread widely. Rubus erectus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks.
